item.title: Morris add a quote by William Shakespeare
Morris add a quote by John Le Carre
item.description: "Coming home from very lonely places, all of us go a little mad: whether from great personal success, or just an all-night drive, we are the sole survivors of a world no one else has ever seen." -- John Le Carre

item.title: Morris add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Morris add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Simplicity, simplicity, simplicity! I say, let your affairs be as two or three, and not a hundred or a thousand; instead of a million count half a dozen, and keep your accounts on your thumb nail." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Morris add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "The most I can do for my friend is simply to be his friend." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Morris add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Could a greater miracle take place than for us to look through each other’s eyes for an instant?" -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Morris add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "be yourself- not your idea of what you think somebody else's idea of yourself should be." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Morris add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Heaven is under our feet as well as over our heads." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Morris add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Do not hire a man who does your work for money, but him who does it for love of it." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Morris add a quote by Thoreau Henry David
item.description: "As long as I have the friendship of the sesasons life will never be a burden to me." -- Thoreau Henry David

item.title: Morris add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Be it life or death, we crave only reality." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Morris add a quote by P.T. Barnum
item.description: "The noblest art is that of making others happy" -- P.T. Barnum

item.title: Morris add a quote by P.T. Barnum
item.description: "Nobody ever lost a dollar by underestimating the taste of the American public." -- P.T. Barnum

item.title: Morris add a quote by David Lynch
item.description: "I don't think it was pain that made [Vincent Van Gogh] great - I think his painting brought him whatever happiness he had." -- David Lynch

item.title: Morris add a quote by Vincent Willem van Gogh
item.description: "...and then, I have nature and art and poetry, and if that is not enough, what is enough?" -- Vincent Willem van Gogh

item.title: Morris add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "It is good to love many things, for therein lies the true strength, and whosoever loves much performs much, and can accomplish much, and what is done in love is well done." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Morris add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "It is looking at things for a long time that ripens you and gives you a deeper meaning." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Morris add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "What would life be if we had no courage to attempt anything?" -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Morris add a quote by Vincent van Gogh
item.description: "But for one's health as you say, it is very necessary to work in the garden and see the flowers growing." -- Vincent van Gogh

item.title: Morris add a quote by Vincent Willem van Gogh
item.description: "The only time I feel alive is when I'm painting." -- Vincent Willem van Gogh

item.title: Morris add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "Exaggerate the essential, leave the obvious vague." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Morris add a quote by - Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "I think that I see something deeper, more infinite, more eternal than the ocean in the expression of the eyes of a little baby." -- - Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Morris add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "There is nothing more truly artistic than to love people." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Morris add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "I try more and more to be myself, caring relatively little whether people approve or disapprove." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Morris add a quote by Vincent van Gogh
item.description: "Keep your love of nature, for that is the true way to understand art more and more." -- Vincent van Gogh

item.title: Morris add a quote by Vincent van Gogh
item.description: "I work as diligently on my canvases as the laborers do in their fields." -- Vincent van Gogh

item.title: Morris add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Morris add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "No man needs sympathy because he has to work, because he has a burden to carry. Far and away the best prize that life offers is the chance to work hard at work worth doing." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Morris add a quote by Franklin D. Roosevelt
item.description: "When you get to the end of your rope. Tie a knot and hang on." -- Franklin D. Roosevelt

item.title: Morris add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Happiness does not depend on outward things, but on the way we see them." -- Leo Tolstoy
